data.title: Don't keep the change!
data.statement:
You are the owner of a shop selling magic potions.
The local currency consists of 3 different types of coins:
- bronze: the elementary value
- silver: one silver coin is worth 29 bronze coins
- gold: one gold coin is worth 17 silver coins

As input you get the [[price]] for a potion and the number of each coin type the customer gives you as payment.
You want to give the exact change with the minimum number of total coins possible. Output the number of each coin type. Assume you have an unlimited number of coins each type in your stock.
data.constraints: customer never pays less than the price
data.stubGenerator:
read price:int
read gold:int
read silver:int
read bronze:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>> [[price]]: price for the requested potion in bronze coins (integer)
<<Line 2>> [[gold]]: number of gold coins the customer gives you (integer)
<<Line 3>> [[silver]]: number of silver coins the customer gives you (integer)
<<Line 4>> [[bronze]]: number of bronze coins the customer gives you (integer)
data.outputDescription: One line containing the number of each coin type you return as change, separated by a space: [[gold]] [[silver]] [[bronze]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are the owner of a shop selling magic potions.
The local currency consists of 3 different types of coins:
- bronze: the elementary value
- silver: one silver coin is worth 29 bronze coins
- gold: one gold coin is worth 17 silver coins

As input you get the price for a potion and the number of each coin type the customer gives you as payment.
You want to give the exact change with the minimum number of total coins possible. Output the number of each coin type. Assume you have an unlimited number of coins each type in your stock.
Input
Line 1 price: price for the requested potion in bronze coins (integer)
Line 2 gold: number of gold coins the customer gives you (integer)
Line 3 silver: number of silver coins the customer gives you (integer)
Line 4 bronze: number of bronze coins the customer gives you (integer)
Output
One line containing the number of each coin type you return as change, separated by a space: gold silver bronze
Constraints
customer never pays less than the price
Example
Input
299
1
0
0
Output
0 6 20
